sourceMeaningMnemonic: A <radical>boat</radical> that's <radical>white</radical> isn't just a boat, it's a <kanji>ship</kanji>.
meaningInfo: Boats don't need to be a bright white color. But, ships do! They're dangerous and big, so they paint them nice and white.
readingMnemonic: A white-painted <kanji>ship</kanji> is a kind of <reading>hack</reading> (<ja>はく</ja>). It makes the ship more visible without costing much.
readingInfo: You can also imagine hacking the ship's computer. "Look at me, look at me. You are the hacker now."
